p: We recently reported the analysis of the full genome sequence of 102 strains of the influenza C virus and unveiled a history of frequent reassortment of the virus [ 18]. Reports and sequence data of the virus from many parts of the world have also been increasing [ 37, 38]. In this study, we exploited sequence data available to date, many of which are from our recent study, with phylogenetic techniques to see the evolutionary pathway of the influenza C virus over a period of 68 years. We also compared the evolution of influenza C viruses with those of influenza A and B viruses.
